ACUTE ISSUES: 

# Fall 
# Bilateral pubic rami fractures 
Mechanical fall at home that was unwitnessed. No LOC, no head 
strike. Trauma workup on presentation was notable for bilateral 
pubic rami fractures. Pubic rami fractures were deemed non 
operative by ortho. She was evaluated by ___ who recommended 
rehab. Per ortho recs, she can weight bear as tolerated and 
follow up in ___ trauma clinic in 4 weeks. Her pain was 
treated with standing Tylenol. She did not require oxycodone 
recently this admission and was not discharged on it. 

# Atrial fibrillation 
Pt with known history of afib, but noted in ED to be in afib 
with nonsustained tachycardia up to 130s at times, for which she 
received additional PO Metoprolol with good effect. Her 
metoprolol was uptitrated to 100 metoprolol succinate daily by 
discharge with HR in ___ generally. She was continued on 
apixaban. Transitional issue to monitor HRs to consider 
downtitrating Metoprolol at rehab. 

# HFpEF 
On admission BNP was noted to be elevated above her prior 
baseline, in 7K range from prior in ___ range. Chest imaging 
showing possible mild pulmonary edema. She received IV Lasix in 
ED and was transitioned to PO diuretic regimen; she resumed 
prior regimen of PO Lasix 20 2x/week upon discharge. 

# Asymptomatic bacteruria 
Patient had UA potentially concerning for infection, but she did 
not have any history of urinary symptoms. Urine culture growing 
citrobacter that is pansensitive. She received CTX in ED, but 
given lack of symptoms, further antibiotics were held. 

# Delirium 
She became delirious at times this admission; she has a history 
of sundowning in the hospital. She varied between being AAOX4, 
and at other times somnolent. 

# CKD 
Recent baseline creatinine fluctuating in 1.5-1.7 range. 
Creatinine peaked at 1.9 this admission. Adjustments were made 
to diuretic regimen as above. Discharge creatinine 1.4. 

CHRONIC ISSUES: 

# Polymyalgia Rheumatica 
Continued prednisone 6

# Depression 
Continued sertraline 

# B12 deficiency 
Continued cyanocobalamin
